fields.summary: Add ability to specify range or limit of events displayed on dashboard
More accurate license error message
On Dashboard, show only one record of an event that spans multiple days
Add the ability to view recently lapsed events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51022].
  {panel}

It amazes me that such a powerful program is lacking some fundamental features. This issue can prolly be broken up into sub issues - but I will leave that up to someone else to do. 

I really love what jira and confluence has done to our workflow but at the same time it has also hurt our workflow with simple, yet missing, features.

1: Reminders. It is ultimately important that people get reminded about an events if a reminder is setup in a calendar. Many people are mobile now days and subscribe to the team calendars or a personal calendar. For instance I am out of the office in meetings all the time and with the new team calendars I never get reminded of my next meeting. This is quite annoying as it is something that I rely on a daily basis. Why such a simple and powerful feature is missing escapes me.

2: Making changes to the calendar. Again being mobile quite a bit I may have a client call and want to change their appointment to another time. I have my phone subscribed - but I can't make changes in my phones calendar and therefore I have to resort to going to the website and putting in my login information etc and making the change. This adds time and unnecessary steps.

3: Adding the time to the fields is a bit cumbersome sometimes. When I enter time into the team calendars I always have to remember to type it in properly in military time. When in other systems a simple drop down of time broken up in 15 minute blocks I can easily select from.

These 3 above are so utterly important - not just to use (who come from using Google Calendar) but I am almost certain for many other people as well.

I hope that these get implemented soon.
fields.summary: Missing features from team calendar
Ability to see who created a calendar event
Ability to send a daily email, weekly email with all events scheduled
Make calendar features more discoverable
Drag and dropping JIRA events should not reload the calendar
Event who field configuration restriction
Option to color code Team Calendar entries
Adding a new calendar UX - clicking OK should give "Adding..." feedback.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51014].
  {panel}

Team Calendars currently constructs _URLDataSources_ with the Confluence base URL [com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.notification.DefaultCalendarNotificationManager.createWebResourceDataSource(String)]. This means these are HTTP URLs, and when being handed over to the Java Mail framework as being wrapped in a DataHandler [com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.notification.DefaultCalendarNotificationManager.createWebResourceDataHandler(String)] for a MimeBodyPart, this will result in an HTTP request being send to its own server for resolving the resource during message construction.

A typical stack looks like this:

{code}
at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1436)
at java.net.URL.openStream(URL.java:1010)
at javax.activation.URLDataSource.getInputStream(URLDataSource.java:92)
at javax.activation.DataHandler.writeTo(DataHandler.java:290)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.writeTo(MimeBodyPart.java:1403)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.writeTo(MimeBodyPart.java:874)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart.writeTo(MimeMultipart.java:444)
at com.sun.mail.handlers.multipart_mixed.writeTo(multipart_mixed.java:102)
at javax.activation.ObjectDataContentHandler.writeTo(DataHandler.java:869)
at javax.activation.DataHandler.writeTo(DataHandler.java:302)
at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.writeTo(MimeBodyPart.java:1403)
{code}

You see that the java.net.URL.openStream is called which uses the standard lib's primitive HTTP client in order to resolve the resource. Apart from this being a very inefficient operation (it could really be just resolved over the file system / file URL) *it makes the assumption that this resource is available to an unauthenticated request*.


h4. Workarounds for customers affected by this:
# Disable Team Calendars
# Disable notifications from Team Calendars, by adding this JVM parameter: *-Dcom.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.notification.enabled=false* and restarting Confluence.
fields.summary: Constructing a mail should not result in resolving resources over HTTP

In some instance we'd like to use the people calendar to track staff movements and two people may be attending one event...such as a conference...therefore it would be good to have both people attached to one calendar item.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50998].
  {panel}

In the my calendars page, a user can set colors for calendars, but this only affects that user's view. 

When a calendar is rendered in a page using the my calendars view, it is rendered in the color chosen by the creator of the calendar. A better solution would be to: 

* Use the default (creator chosen) color if the user has _*not*_ added this calendar to _my calendars_.
* Use the user chosen color if the user has added this calendar to _my calendars_.

This is a related request to TEAMCAL-181.
fields.summary: Calendar colors, when embedded to a page, should be based on the user's subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50989].
  {panel}

As can be seen in the screenshot, the display of calendar items with long titles is inconsistent between Events and People calendars.

The timebound Event calendar item stays within the bounds of the time slot
The all day People calendar item extends the "all day" slot

Staying within the bounds of the timeslot makes the most amount of sense - however, a tooltip on hover that displays the event information in full would be helpful. Such a tooltip is currently missing.

!2011-12-23_1218.png!

fields.description:
Currently when a calendar is hidden, visiting "My Calendars" the Calendar will not be shown by default.

This is confusing for some users, as they expect them to be visible when visiting "My Calendars".

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a calendar called "dchui's holiday" then hide it
# Visit http://confluenceURL/calendar/mycalendar.action
# "dchui's holiday" calendar won't be visible by default unless we click on it first

It will be nice if we can have an option to enable them by default.
fields.summary: Allow auto enable calendar to make them visible by default

fields.description:
All new OnDemand instances will be bundled with Team Calendars in the near future, and customers can choose to activate their 30 day trial of Team Calendars when their OnDemand instance is provisioned, or they can choose to start the trial at a later date. If they choose the latter, no Team Calendar UI should show up in Confluence until the trial is activated.

Note this requires Team Calendars to acknowledge three different license states: inactive (no license), licensed and expired.
fields.summary: Don't display any UI items when not licensed in OnDemand

fields.description:
At the moment the dashboard macro shows upcoming events for the next 5? days.

If there a lot of events over the next few days the dashboard list can get very large (eg EAC, subscribe to the PM travel calendar around Summit time).

The ideal solution is that we limit the upcoming events to the next X number of events, regardless of the number of days.
fields.summary: Limit dashboard upcoming events by total number of events (not days)
Ability to restore deleted events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50965].
  {panel}

We've had several requests for the ability to subscribe to a single event in team calendars. Some suggestions: 
* Allow an export to .ics of single event while viewing event details. 
* Allow a user to "Watch" a single event and get ical invitation updates
* When a user gets notified of an event added they have the ability to "watch the event" to stay notified of updates.
fields.summary: Ability to watch (or subscribe) to an event from my personal email client
Ability to archive old calendar events for calendar navigation performance reasons
Render JIRA Calendar Links for Summary Emails

Resolved issues should look different to open issues
Ability to disable external calendar subscriptions
Dashboard: Location
Prompt Confluence admin before notifying all users about Team Calendar plugin post-installation/upgrade through workbox, or provide an option to not do so

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50953].
  {panel}

I just went through the process of moving a space from one Confluence instance to another.

Steps:
1. Export space from old instance
2. Import space to new instance
3. Export the Calendar associated with the space in the old instance
4. Import the Calendar to the new instance, and associate it with the space

I then noticed that all usages of the calendar in the pages of the space were broken - it seems that this is because they rely on the calendar id, and this gets changed during the export/import process. This means I now have to identify all uses of the calendar macro, and update them.

My suggestion is to include the calendar information in the Space export for any linked calendars, meaning that they get restored with the same id in the new instance after being imported. Failing that, another workaround would be to manually set the id for the calendar after importing to the new instance.
fields.summary: Include Team Calendar details in Confluence Space Exports
To be able top optionally turn off the display of the JIRA issue key on the calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50951].
  {panel}

Currently it seems the time displayed on both the month and week view are hardcoded to 12h time and not respecting the localization configuration. An option to at least allow switching between 12h and 24h mode would be preferable, or perhaps an option to supply the preferred time format for a view.

For now our workaround in the monthly view (which is the one we use) is to patch the default for timeFormat in fullcalendar.js from "h(:mm)t" to "HH:mm" which gives us 24 hour time, so the functionality is there. Would prefer not to have to tamper on every upgrade. :)

h4. Workaround
Check [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-258?focusedCommentId=317637&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-317637]. Note that you will need to do the same whenever you upgraded the Team Calendars plugin.
fields.summary: Selectable 12/24 hour display in monthly and weekly view
Users should be able to cancel out of the "set timezone" modal dialog
Unable to create JIRA Calendar

fields.description:
If I remove a calendar from my list that I am watching it should also remove my watch. 

I know this was discussed with Bill, but I just had a chat to Bill and we think we should remove the watch as well. Reasons why:
* We've made it annoying for users who just don't want any more info about a calendar - they have to re-subscribe, un-watch and then un-subscribe 
* I think it's safe to assume if you remove a calendar form your list you are no longer interested in the calendar
* The use case for removing a calendar and still wanting to watch it is very low
fields.summary: Removing a calendar from my list should remove the watch
Padding is out for the text in the first selection box for feature discovery dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50912].
  {panel}

We have team Calendars installed on our Confluence instance and it is very helpful, however we have found one issue.  Due to multiple sales and integrations, we now have 3 domains that all bring back our confluence site, wiki.yellowpages.com wiki.attinteractive.com & wiki.atti.com, however Team Calendars will only work with the domain attinteractive.com which is the base actual domain.  It is critical that not only the old domains be supported, but also we know that we are changing again and will need to add a 4th.  All must bring back the calendar for it to be useful to us. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C; InfoPath.3)
Timestamp: Wed, 16 May 2012 17:50:37 UTC

Message: Access is denied.

Line: 241
Char: 287
Code: 0
URI: http://wiki.yellowpages.com/s/en/2160/17/38/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js

fields.description:
We changed the dashboard upcoming events a while ago to be limited by the number of events.

On CONFXHTML, it looks like if you are subscribed to a JIRA calendar with a lot of events, it does not respect this limit: https://skitch.com/sherif/fxauj/52-dashboard-confluence

To test this out, on CONFX, subscribe to "Sarah's JIRA calendar", then go to the dashboard.. the list is _Really_ long.
fields.summary: Number of events limitation does not apply on the dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50897].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a JIRA project with two custom fields: one with a date picker field and the other with a date time field 
** it seems to be important that these fields are different. Failed to reproduce issue with two date time fields
** whether the fields are global or local is not relevant
# Create a JIRA calendar that links to this project and select the custom fields above to be mapped
# Create a JIRA issue and populate the fields above with the same date

Once the sync between the JIRA issue and the JIRA issue happens, the results of step 3 will be represented as two separate entries on two different dates. They should be represented on the same date.

Part of this issue is due to TEAMCALs not representing what field the Jira calendar item is linked to (TEAMCAL-432; even if they appeared on the same day, it would still be pretty confusing)
fields.summary: JIRA Issues which have more than one date / time field that point to the same date will not appear on the same date on the JIRA calendar
Calendar embed macro seems to have some things hardcoded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50891]. {panel} There are a bunch of
elements in the header which make the document invalid, and potentially make content appear in the page which shouldn't be there: {noformat}

fields.description:
Copying the cached calendars in the cache in Confluence clustered results in:

{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal property [PRODID]
at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.PropertyFactoryImpl.createProperty(PropertyFactoryImpl.java:1060)
at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Property.copy(Property.java:524)
at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.PropertyList.<init>(PropertyList.java:76)
at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Calendar.<init>(Calendar.java:179)
at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.copyCalendar(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:249)
at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getSubCalendarContent(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:225)
{noformat}

This is because the registered property/parameter factories deep inside ical4j were gone after the deserialization, and because of how java.io.Serializable was implemented, the factories weren't reregistered.
fields.summary: Calendars read from the cache cannot be used in the copy constructor
Team Calendars v2.1.1 won't install in Confluence v4.2 running on Windows XP

If a user gets a link to a team calendar via the "Share" option, they get the Page Not Found. This is distinct to when a calendar is embedded in the page. Here, the error message is more helpful. Could this be made consistent across both scenarios? That is

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50867].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian team,

In our case we have different URLs for the same wiki platform (depending on intranet/extranet/internet).

In the configuration panel, we set the base URL to the intranet URL one.

Users using the other URLs are not able to create calendar because you use the base URL to define the time zone => "BaseUrl/rest/calendar-services/1.0/timezones/calendar". They also could not display the already created calendar.

Could you please make the link "rest/calendar-services/1.0/timezones/calendar" relative and not based on the BaseUrl?

Regards

Gargouri

Is it possible to add the following functionality to calendars in Confluence?:
> 1. View full calendar year.
> 2. Toggle view among Day/Week/Month/Year from macro.
> 3. Add color coding for specific items without using different calendars for each color.
> 4. Toggle view of various groups off/on from Macro (much like the option available through the "my calendars" view).
> 5. Enable edit permissions without delete permissions so that users can add/remove events but not accidentally delete the calendar.
